page.title: 14Housing
page.content: The only area with any degree of modern housing was in Purleigh village. Elsewhere the housing ranged from very old, vast buildings many of which had been restored to tiny cottages, many of them farmers tied cottages, which had few basic amenities. We found several houses with not only no main drainage but in some cases no electricity either. Some were built directly on the bare ground with no foundations. The local planning department at Maldon informs us that there are no plans for further housing development in the area in the near future.
